description.narrative: 1.1.5 By the end of 2015, the government ensures an increasingly integrated and functional protection and prevention system, including alternative care, for children - especially the most vulnerable and marginalised children - who are at risk of discrimination, violence and abuse., which contributes to Child Protection Systems, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Disparity Reduction, Social Inclusion and Protection
